ext_description.p: An Edge_segment_cross_section is a type of .
the referencing_template specifies an inverse relationship for the Edge_segment_cross_section.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the associated_template specifies a role of for Edge_segment_cross_section.
the cross_section_reference specifies a role of for Edge_segment_cross_section.

ext_description.p: the projected_volume specifies a role of the for the Edge_segment_cross_section.
the projected_volume specifies a role of the for the Edge_segment_cross_section.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: associated_template shall also be a referencing_template.
An Inter_stratum_feature_edge_segment_template is a type of .
the cross_section specifies the for the Inter_stratum_feature_edge_segment_template. The value of this attribute is optional and need not be specified.
the reference_path specifies the for the Inter_stratum_feature_edge_segment_template.
the end_vertex specifies one role of the for the Inter_stratum_feature_edge_segment_template.
the start_vertex specifies one role of the for the Inter_stratum_feature_edge_segment_template.
the composed_edge specifies the role of the the Inter_stratum_feature_edge_segment_template is helping to compose.
Either refering Inter_stratum_feature_edge_segment_template as or cross_section shall exists.
Both and of reference_path shall exist.
If of start_vertex exists than it will also be the for reference_path.
If of start_vertex exists than it will also be the for reference_path.
If of end_vertex exists than it will also be the for reference_path.
If of end_vertex exists than it will also be the for reference_path.
The end_vertex shall not be the start_vertex.
An Inter_stratum_feature_edge_template is a type of .

the edges is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Inter_stratum_feature_edge_template is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Inter_stratum_feature_edge_template as its . There shall be two or more for an Inter_stratum_feature_edge_template.

ext_description.p: A Cutout is a type of . A Cutout may be a , a or a . A Cutout is a closed, internal shape in a substrate. A Cutout may not extend completely through the substrate. Complex Cutouts may be created by using the facilities in .
ext_description.example: Figure 1 illustrates the information required to fabricate the interconnect substrate and also assemble a component onto the interconnect. The Cutout illustrated has a form that is dependent on the component installed in it. Each end of the internal conductor path shown in the figure that mates with a component terminal should be modeled as an . During design of the interconnect substrate, thees features would be considered as interface features whose location is controlled by the mating requirement. In this example the mating requirement is simplified because the component is not a connector.

figure.title: Cutout plan view showing installed component

ext_description.example: Figure 2 illustrates a detail that shows information required to fabricate the interconnect substrate. The Cutout illustrated includes a blind passage at the base. The blind passage would be defined by a .

figure.title: Cutout cross-section view showing installed component

ext_description.p: A Cutout_edge_segment is a type of that defines an edge segment of a . When the Cutout_edge_segment participates in a that is fully described by a collection of Cutout_edge_segment, the end_vertex of the final segment shall be the start_vertex of the first segment. Adjacent Cutout_edge_segment reference the same member of but in different roles to ensure continuity.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the derived_from that is inherited from shall be reclared as for the Cutout_edge_segment.
the end_vertex specifies one role of an for the Cutout_edge_segment.
the start_vertex specifies one role of an for the Cutout_edge_segment.
the composed_cutout specifies the that contains the Cutout_edge_segment.
The Cutout_edge_segment shall help to compose only inner features of the
The start_vertex shall not be the end_vertex.
A Partially_plated_cutout is a type of that is not a completely plated cutout for reason of manufacturing capabilities or design purposes.

an unplated_segment is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Partially_plated_cutout is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Partially_plated_cutout as a . There shall be one or more in the role of unplated_segment for the Partially_plated_cutout. The unplated_segment specifies the segment that is unplated.

a plated_segment is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Partially_plated_cutout is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Partially_plated_cutout as a . There shall be one or more in the role of plated_segment for the Partially_plated_cutout. The plated_segment specifies the segment that is plated.
A Plated_cutout_edge_segment is a type of and is a type of that helps compose a . The Plated_cutout_edge_segment is a feature with a specified shape that makes up part of the edge of a .
the composed_cutout specifies the for whose edge this Plated_cutout_edge_segment is a segment.

ext_description.p: A Physical_connectivity_interrupting_cutout is a type of that is included in the design of an for the purpose of interrupting one or more connectivity elements in an .
ext_description.note: A Physical_connectivity_interrupting_cutout is used where a relayout of the design that would remove the connectivity elements from the design is not provided, but where traceability to a is required.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the interrupted_connectivity_element specifies the that is interrupted with the Physical_connectivity_interrupting_cutout. There shall be one or more for a Physical_connectivity_interrupting_cutout.

A Plated_cutout is a type of and a type of . The Plated_cutout is an interior volume of the substrate, such as a void included for passage of a shaft, and may be plated for EMI shielding purposes. This object conveys the semantic that the interior referenced by the related shape is conductive.

ext_description.p: A Dielectric_material_passage is a type of that contains dielectric material. The extent of the Dielectric_material_passage is between the boundary defined by the of this Dielectric_material_passage and the shape of the that is to be filled with dielectric material during manufacture.
ext_description.example: Figure 4 illustrates an exploded, stylized, detail of a Dielectric_material_passage as it appears in two sequential stages of the fabrication process.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the precedent_passage specifies the that defines the outer boundary of the Dielectric_material_passage before it is filled with the specified non-conductive .

the feature_material specifies either the or the that defines the dielectric material contained in the Dielectric_material_passage. The feature_material need not be specified for a particular Dielectric_material_passage.

An Interconnect_module_edge is a type of . An Interconnect_module_edge may be a or a . When this information is represented by a planar shape, the interpretation is to be that the planar shape represents a projection of the maximum extent of the Interconnect_module_edge onto the planar shape. The Interconnect_module_edge forms an outer physical boundary of the interconnect substrate.

ext_description.p: An Interconnect_module_edge_segment is a type of . An Interconnect_module_edge_segment may be a . The Interconnect_module_edge_segment is an entity with a uniquely specified shape that makes up part of the edge of an interconnect module.
ext_description.example: Usually each side of a four-sided board is an Interconnect_module_edge_segment, or if a board is a round board, one of the Interconnect_module_edge_segment's may be a notch for orientation purposes. The set of Interconnect_module_edge_segment's together make up the total edge.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the derived_from specifies the role of the for an Interconnect_module_edge_segment.
the end_vertex specifies the final for an Interconnect_module_edge_segment.
the start_vertex specifies the initial for an Interconnect_module_edge_segment.
the composed_edge specifies the role of the for the Interconnect_module_edge_segment.
The end_vertex shall not be the start_vertex.
A Partially_plated_interconnect_module_edge is a type of that is not a completely plated edge for reason of manufacturing capabilities or design purposes.

an unplated_segment is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Partially_plated_interconnect_module_edge is dependent upon the existence of the that specifies the Partially_plated_interconnect_module_edge in the role of . There shall be one or more for the Partially_plated_interconnect_module_edge.

a plated_segment is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Partially_plated_interconnect_module_edge is dependent upon the existence of the that specifies the Partially_plated_interconnect_module_edge in the role of . There shall be one or more for the Partially_plated_interconnect_module_edge.
A Plated_interconnect_module_edge is a type of that forms one of the edges of an interconnect substrate.

ext_description.p: A Plated_interconnect_module_edge_segment is a type of that forms a section of the edge of an interconnect substrate.
ext_description.example: Figure 5 illustrates an edge segment that is plated. Note that the opposite side of the cross-section is unplated. There is not enough information in the figure to define the extent of the plated segment.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the composed_edge specifies the that contains the Plated_interconnect_module_edge_segment.
